titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: We lunched with the Cavendishes at the Prison–Governor's house. Mr Hodgson was one of the party. After lunch I presided at a meeting of the 'Discharged Prisoners' Aid Society', and made a speech.

p.hi: I ordered the "Dead March" to be played in the cathedral after Mattins & Evensong, as the Funeral of Archdeacon Price took place today at Brookwood.
The "Times" did not arrive until after Evensong.
It contains my letter on the Athanasian Creed
I attended Evensong in the Cathedral, & then wrote letters to Reggie Still & Ernest Bennett.
